en_question: A large room with a volume of \(1800\) m^3 initially contains \(76\%\) carbon dioxide. Fresh air with only \(58\%\) carbon dioxide is pumped into the room at a rate of \(8\) m^3/min, and mixed air leaves the room at the same rate to maintain constant volume. What will be the percentage of carbon dioxide in the room after 9 minutes? Express your answer to five significant figures.
